revised_title: An Overview of Scientific Discoveries and Developments in the Royal Society of London (1942)
tldr: This collection of abstracts from the Royal Society of London in 1942 covers a wide range of scientific disciplines, including physics, biology, chemistry, astronomy, environmental science, medicine, mathematics, engineering, social sciences, and biographies. The articles discuss various topics such as reproductive cycles in animals, cosmic ray intensity, Hp values of radium, chlorophyll activation, and more. These summaries provide a glimpse into the groundbreaking research and discoveries made by the society during that time.
